title: eazyCipher
desc: Perhaps wearing glasses would be 62x more helpful.

title: Commitment issues
desc: You're a Pentester at Hackevil Solutions and has been tasked with leading a black box pentest for the company. During your reconnaissance phase, you discovered a potential vulnerability that led you to a zip file. Can you find the secrets of the universe?

title: National-Steggraphic
desc: Shathra the curious wanderer stumbled upon a hidden library filled with government archives. There, she discovered an enigmatic image, but unable to decipher its meaning, she sought the help of her tech-savvy friend, Svar. As Svar, it's up to you to use your leet skills to unravel the hidden message and report back to your adventurous friend Shathra before it's too late.

title: Go Take a Walk!
desc: Walking is a simple yet effective way to improve your health. Not only is it a great form of low-impact exercise that can prevent witches from hexing you, but it can also make you touch grass. Go ahead, Take a walk!

title: nanotechnology
desc: Nano: A house keeper who has to take care of many people at once “Man am I lucky to have a Nano!”

title: Ceaser's secrets
desc:
Alright, pay attention. So, my buddy Ceaser bursts into the room, all hyped up, and starts blabbering about how he's come up with the most secure encryption algorithm ever. I mean, who has the time or the expertise to dive into that stuff, right? But here's where you come in. need you, my friend, I really do.
I managed to get his encryption algorithm. I overheard him say that it doesn't encrypt Numbers and special characters except brackets. Break it for me!

title: Interception
desc: Intelligence has discovered that insurgents are using VoIP softphones to communicate. Our spy, Bob, has intercepted one of the leader's calls. This could potentially lead to uncovering their next attack. Find out what the insurgents are planning.

title: Gobsufucated!
desc: Caesar McDonald wasn't too thrilled when you managed to crack his code. But now he's come up with a brand new encryption algorithm, and rumor has it that his friend Freddy gave it a solid pentest.

title: sequeli-University
desc: Bypass the university portal to access the secrets. Press the deploy button to start.

title: Crush Search
desc:
Looking for answers? Look no further! Crush search, the ultimate Crush-search engine, is here to help. Just type in your crush's name and discover a world of information at your fingertips, even the phone number!. Fast, reliable, and easy to use, Don't waste time, start Crushing today!

Note: You're encouraged to exploit the flaw manually.

title: Breaking
hint: Find all bad chars to bypass
desc: The Web-Times has requested a black box pentest. As a pentester, find ways to exploit the server and retrive the flag.

title: Red or Blue
desc:
Would you rather choose the red pill or the blue pill?
Submit the flag in format: rctf{}

title: Pipeline
desc: Pipeline Inc. believes that a rapid CI/CD pipeline is the key to a successful technology corporation. In fact, they are so committed to this concept that they named their company after it.

title: Lee's Fight club
hint: Reading between the lines is a skill (rules)
desc:
First Rule of Lee's Club, don't talk about Lee. Lee's Club is something you never talk about. Why? Because it is the first rule of Fight Club.

Note: This challenge does not require any type of bruteforce or automated testing.

title: Obsecurity
desc: I look around, I look around I see a lot of new faces. said Tyler Durden. This has nothing to do with the challenge though.

title: The Fish-Mail
hint: The binaries used in this challenge are not malicious.
desc: Employees in the Calcutta shaving company has been receiving a lot of suspicious phishing email's lately. Although the Employees has been made aware, DevOps manager and part time Fishing Enthusiast Jyll had fallen pray to the phishing campaign. Jyll's desktop was infected with an unknown malware, and the security team is concerned that confidential data may have been compromised. As a part of the Incident response team, You've been tasked with Identifying the threat actor and analyse the situation.

title: RSA! RSA!
desc: What are those weirdly long numbers?

title: Gutti Mystery
desc:
A stranger slipped this into my mailbox. How do they know my cat's name? We need to figure out who they are.

Note: This challenge was part of the Glitch CTF 2023, therefore the flags is in format glitch{}

title: Intrusion
desc: Things are not going well at the Calcutta Shaving Company (CSC™). They are under constant attack, and this time, the Wheelbarrow, a café owned by CSC™, has been hit. There are doubts as to whether the attackers have already broken in. The company is deeply impressed by your previous work and wishes for you to conduct an investigation.

title: Secure-Vault
desc:
Welcome Agent 47, the vault has been located, It's up to you to take it from here.

Note: Submit the MD5 of the retrieved secret as flag, wrap the MD5 with rctf{} Example: If the secret is "s3c>r3t" submit in format rctf{md5("sec>r3t")}
